ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Computer Question
ygData.msgSnippet: All you need is a router and enough Ethernet cables to connect each computer to the router, which in turn connects to your DSL modem. You can find a four-port
ygData.messageBody:
All you need is a router and enough Ethernet cables to connect each computer
to the router, which in turn connects to your DSL modem. You can find a
four-port router from Linksys or D-Link in most shops that sell computer
hardware, and they're not too pricey. Configuration shouldn't be too
difficult, as a lot of consumer routers come with an installation CD that
will help users to configure their computers and the router to share an
Internet connection.

Chris

-----Original Message-----
From: STG2 Pierce [mailto:piercer@...]
Sent: Monday, September 29, 2003 1:18 AM
To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: [EverQuest] Computer Question


Hello everyone I have question for you guys. Now before I start off I am
just starting to learn the hardware side of computers so bear with me lol,
now my question is what items would be needed in order to have 3 computers
share 1 DSL line? When I get back I'm gonna buy a laptop and have one of my
friends move in with me so we'll have 3 computers total on 1 DSL line thats
the reason why I ask this question. Thanks for any help you guys can give
me.

Dabruiser Troll
Warrior of the 29th Season
